poem:
Title: Upon the Tarnished Halo

In the shadow of the hospital,
fraud corrupts the healing hand.
False qualifications flutter
like moth-eaten banners in the wind
and the sick man in the starched bed
hears not the gentle rhythms of care,
only the harsh clang of deception.
Where trust was once implicit,
now suspicion gnaws at its foundation.
Oh, the careworn faces of the innocent,
caught in this conspiracy of deceit.
